data.title: Dugongs 'may decline 70%'
data.description: Dugong populations in the Andaman Sea are expected to decline by 70% over the next four years due to the diminishing supply of seagrass, which is their main source of food, a marine biologist has warned.

data.title: Maris allays concerns on OCA in Gulf
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa sought to allay concerns over upcoming talks with Cambodia regarding issues related to the Overlapping Claims Area (OCA) in the Gulf of Thailand, stressing that for the negotiations to be successful, they must be mutually accepted by both nations.

data.title: Minister confirms stable Thai-US ties in post-election outcome
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa said Thailand

data.title: Kittiratt off the hook for rice sale
data.description: The attorney-general has decided not to appeal the acquittal of former commerce minister Kittiratt Na-Ranong  in a malfeasance case linked to the sale of  rice  to Indonesia in 2011, according to an informed source.

data.title: PM gives top priority to food security
data.description: Promoting Thailand’s  exports  and addressing  food security  concerns are among the major issues to be raised at two regional meetings in China, Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  said on Wednesday.

data.title: Iconic Italian ship docks in Phuket
data.description: PHUKET - Amerigo Vespucci, a tall ship of the Italian Navy named after the 16th century explorer, has arrived at Phuket Deep Sea Port and is welcoming visitors aboard to explore an exhibition of Italian art, culture and architecture.

data.title: Two alleged yakuza held for abduction, extortion
data.description: Two Japanese men accused of abducting a compatriot and extorting money from him before physically assaulting and forcing him to eat faeces have been arrested at a resort in Chon Buri.

data.title: State railway sees ‘huge promise’ in 28 land plots
data.description: The  State Railway of Thailand  (SRT) is pinning its hopes on planned commercial  development  of 38,500 rai of land it owns, including 28 plots with “enormous” potential, to bring in 20 billion baht in revenue over the next four years.

data.title: Tourists offered free Thai holiday if they smuggle weed back to Britain
data.description: British authorities have asked Thai police to arrest Britons smuggling cannabis back to the UK in exchange for a free holiday in Thailand with pocket money..

data.title: Over 94,000 illegal Chinese products seized in Bangkok
data.description: The Food and Drug Administration has seized more than 94,000 illegal Chinese products from dozens of shops in Bangkok over the past three months.

data.title: Chinese, Taiwanese gamblers arrested in Bangkok
data.description: Police  arrested  15 Chinese and Taiwanese  gamblers  at an illegal den inside a closed eatery in Wang Thonglang district of  Bangkok  on Tuesday night.

data.title: Four killed, 9 injured when pickup hits trailer truck
data.description: SURAT THANI - Four people were killed and nine others injured when a box pickup truck carrying Myanmar workers rear-ended a trailer truck in Tha Chana district in the early hours of Wednesday.

data.title: PM to tackle disparity at meets
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra is scheduled to attend two regional meetings held in Kunming, China, today and tomorrow before travelling to Peru for the Apec summit on Sunday, Jirayu Houngsub, spokesman for the Prime Minister

data.title: PM 'won't meddle' in Thaksin probe
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra gave assurances yesterday that she would not interfere in an ongoing probe into claims that her father, former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra, was given privileged treatment during his detention at the Police General Hospital (PGH).

data.title: Stats reveal secondhand smoke dangers
data.description: Thailand ranks fifth in the world for having the highest number of female victims of secondhand smoke, whose risk of developing breast cancer is 1.24 times higher than those living in tobacco-free environments, according to a health expert.

data.title: Calls for assembly to draft new charter
data.description: The coalition parties have agreed that a constitutional drafting assembly (CDA) should be established and any changes it recommends must genuinely benefit the people, according to the Bhumjaithai (BJT) Party.

data.title: Boy student dies during running 'test'
data.description: PHICHIT: A Matthayom 4 (Grade 10) student died after a fitness test during a physical education class on Monday.

data.title: PM tackles disputed sea area
data.description: The government expects to form a Joint Technical Committee (JTC) in the next two weeks to negotiate issues related to overlapping maritime area ownership dispute with Cambodia, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said.

data.title: Activists flag reservoir risks
data.description: A group of environmentalists has asked a House committee to investigate two reservoir construction projects which they say could pose a threat to the Dong Phayayen–Khao Yai Forest Complex, a Unesco World Heritage site.

data.title: Moo Deng ‘predicts’ Trump win
data.description: As Americans vote for their next president, the superstar baby pygmy hippo  Moo Deng  has predicted former president  Donald Trump  will win the election.
